subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] THe Ovilus
author: Marlboro63@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1218563910
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I am not in any group per say.  I just go out with my friends and have  fun 
doing what we do.  I have some VERY good friends on here that I  consider 
family and we exchange information on a daily basis.  When I get  my website up and 
running I will be forming a 4-5 person investigative  team.  But until then 
its just my wife and I enjoy going out and having fun  talking with the 
deceased ........:)
 
Jeff
 
 
In a message dated 8/12/2008 12:46:54 P.M. Central Standard Time,  
debbie.fransen@... writes:

 
 
 
Jeff,
What group are you in? 
 

 
____________________________________
 From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups EVP-ITC@yahoogroups EVP-ITC@yahoogr EVP-On Behalf 
Of  Marlboro63@...
Sent: Tuesday, August 12, 2008 1:44  PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups EVP
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC]  THe Ovilus




Elabeth,
 
I have A LOT OF TOYS at this time.  Which I am sure a lot of other  
paranormal investigators have as well.  I am not selling this unit  because it does not 
work but because it does work and I have lots of other  toys and boxes that 
work as well.  I also have a few other boxes that I  will be selling and maybe 
listing on Ebay as well.  And I just recently  went on an investigation at 
Eastern State Penn and I had so much equipment  there and not enough hands or 
body to carry it, LOL.  So I do not want to  put myself in that position oagain.
 
Jeff
 
 
In a message dated 8/12/2008 11:43:19 A.M. Central Standard Time,  
elabeth@... a messag

 
 
 
I'll ask some local ghost hunters I know if they'd be interested  and
pass along your email addy. If you get great responses then why  sell
it? I know they're gonna ask. haha I'd keep the toys that work  well.
I'm sure the editing did cut out some waiting around etc., and  I
haven't read Ryan's blog about the episode yet. He will usually  say
something about it there if the editing is done to make something  seem
more than what it was and I've seen him express concern  about
production things there before, so I think he'll mention it if  the
footage was heavily edited.

~Elabeth

On Tue, Aug 12,  2008 at 11:29 AM, <_Marlboro63@..._ 
(mailto:Marlboro63@...) >  wrote:
> Hi Elabeth,
>
> You have to remember much of what  the Ovilus 1 said probably ended up on 
the
> editing room floor. But  it does work. I get great responses from mine.
> The (7) different  modes on it work very well. But if you know anyone who
> wants one  please let me know. I was informed I have to sell some of my toys
> to  afford to buy new toys...LOLOL I would sell it for $165.00 and it is  in
> brand new condition and only used a few times.
>
>  Jeff
>
> In a message dated 8/12/2008 11:24:20 A.M. Central  Standard Time,
> _elabeth@..._ (mailto:elabeth@...)   writes:
>
> I thought it was pretty neat that it repeated the  word "worry" when
> Ryan asked if it was worried they'd bring in a  priest.
> What are the odds of that just based on environmental  readings? If I
> had an extra $200 laying around I'd be buying myself  one to play with.
> ~Elabeth
>
> On Tue, Aug 12, 2008 at  7:41 AM, Fransen, Debbie
> <_debbie.fransen@..._ (mailto:debbie.fransen@...) >  wrote:
>> I don't know how many of the members watch Paranormal  State, but they used
>> a new piece of equipment called The Ovilus.  You guys have got to check
>> this
>> out. Go to  www.digitaldowsing. out. Go to  www.digitaldowsing.<WB
>>  are,
>> and
>> where they came up with this. To me, it  sounds kind of like Frank's Box,
>> but
>> not the  same.
>> Frank, please take a look at this, and tell us what you  think.
>> I don't understand how it works......
>>  Deb
>
>
>
>  ____________  __  __ 
> Looking for a car  that's sporty, fun and fits in your budget? Read reviews
> on AOL  Autos.
>
